Organization based in.content:
Please analyze the given text to identify relationships where an organization is headquartered or primarily operates in a specific location. Look for patterns that indicate this type of relationship.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Organization', 'Location', 'Whether the Organization is based in the Location']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

Paragraph: This greatly eases the government 's policy that was decided upon at the August reunification-related ministers meeting in which it decided that ` businessmen will be allowed to visit North Korea only when North Korea completely returns to the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty and agrees to the inspection of unreported facilities in Yongbyon. '

Let's think step by step.

| Organization | Location | Whether the Organization is based in the Location |
|---|---|---|
| Government | August reunification-related ministers meeting location | No (The location of the meeting is not specified in the text) |
| Businessmen | North Korea | No (Businessmen are visiting North Korea, but not based there) |
| North Korea | Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty | No (North Korea is not based in the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty, it's a signatory country) |
| North Korea | Yongbyon | Yes (The text implies that North Korea primarily operates in Yongbyon) |

Note: The table assumes that "Yongbyon" refers to a location within North Korea, as it is a well-known nuclear facility in that country.

Located in.content:

Paragraph: This greatly eases the government 's policy that was decided upon at the August reunification-related ministers meeting in which it decided that ` businessmen will be allowed to visit North Korea only when North Korea completely returns to the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty and agrees to the inspection of unreported facilities in Yongbyon. '

Let's think step by step.

Based on the provided paragraph, I couldn't find any "Location A is located in Location B" relationships. The paragraph mainly discusses the government's policy regarding businessmen's visits to North Korea and mentions the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty and the Yongbyon facilities. However, it does not specify any location being situated within another.

Live in.content:
Please analyze the given paragraph to identify any instances where it implies or states that a person resides or has resided in a specific location.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Person', 'Location', 'Whether the Person has lived in the Location']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

Paragraph: This greatly eases the government 's policy that was decided upon at the August reunification-related ministers meeting in which it decided that ` businessmen will be allowed to visit North Korea only when North Korea completely returns to the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty and agrees to the inspection of unreported facilities in Yongbyon. '

Let's think step by step.

| Person | Location | Whether the Person has lived in the Location |
| --- | --- | --- |
| businessmen | North Korea | No indication in the paragraph that the businessmen have lived in North Korea |
| North Korea | Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty | No indication in the paragraph that North Korea has lived in the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty, as countries cannot reside in a treaty. However, North Korea is a party to the treaty. |
| North Korea | Yongbyon | No indication in the paragraph that North Korea has lived in Yongbyon. Yongbyon is a location within North Korea. |
| unreported facilities | Yongbyon | No indication in the paragraph that the unreported facilities have lived in Yongbyon. They are located in Yongbyon. |
